net.sf.JRecord.Types

Class TypeNum

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.JRecord.Types.TypeChar
      • net.sf.JRecord.Types.TypeNum
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TypeBinBigEndian, TypeBinLittleEndian, TypeCommaDecimalPoint, TypeDecimalHex, TypeFjZoned, TypeFloat, TypeNumAnyDecimal, TypePackedDecimal, TypeRmComp, TypeRmCompPositive, TypeSignSeparate, TypeZoned

    public class TypeNum
extends TypeChar
    This class is the base for all numeric-Type classes + it handles all character based numeric types (apart from zoned)
    Version:
    0.55
    Author:
    Bruce Martin

    • Constructor Detail

      • TypeNum

        public TypeNum(int typeId)
        Character based numeric Numeric Types:
        • ftNumLeftJustified
        • ftNumRightJustified
        • ftNumZeroPadded
        • ftAssumedDecimal

        Note: A "Type" is the interface between the raw data in the file and what is to be displayed on the screen. A "Type" class needs to perform all conversions file and the screen.

        Parameters:
        typeId - Type Identier values are:
        • ftNumLeftJustified
        • ftNumRightJustified
        • ftNumZeroPadded
        • ftAssumedDecimal

      • TypeNum

        public TypeNum(int typeId,
       boolean isPositive)
        Parameters:
        typeId -
        isPositive -

      • isPositive

        public boolean isPositive()
        get the positive value. This attribute was originally setup for internal use (with binary numbers). I will try and fix it for other types, but it might / might not be set correctly. Use it at you own risk !!
        Returns:
        Returns the positive.
